pages.text: Obtaining raw materials can be time-consuming and often leads to mass deforestation. With this ritual, forests can be regrown, as saplings are spread and grown.$(br2)$(info) An already planted sapling or a grown tree is required to start the process.$(br2)$(info) Some trees, such as wildwood trees, cannot be grown by this process.

$(standing_stones) As a $(l:rituals/tiers)$(bold)tier III$() ritual, $(l:rituals/ritual_spreading_forest#multiblock)runed pillars$() (acacia, jungle & spruce) are required. Please see later pages of this entry.
Three $(l:rituals/standing_stones)runed pillar$() are required: acacia, jungle and spruce.

pages.title: Ritual Specifics
pages.text: $(bold)Duration:$() The ritual lasts $(ritual:spreading_forest/SECONDS/duration) seconds.$(br2)$(bold)Size:$() The ritual will search for leaves or saplings within an area of $(ritual:spreading_forest/radius_x) and $(ritual:spreading_forest/radius_z) blocks horizontally, and by $(ritual:spreading_forest/radius_y) blocks vertically.$(br2)$(bold)Placement$(): Saplings are placed every $(ritual:spreading_forest/SECONDS/place_interval) seconds.$(br2)$(bold)Growth$(): Saplings are grown every $(ritual:spreading_forest/SECONDS/growth_interval) seconds.
